Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the Department of Transportation’s designated truck routes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the DOT's designated truck routes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the public authorities law to provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated in passenger service on lines in the New York City transit system that travel through tunnels, under a body of water, or over a bridge; or during instances when trains in passenger service are composed of more than four cars, or are greater than three hundred sixty feet in length, or are able to carry a passenger load of more than 750 persons.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated on safety-sensitive lines in the NYC transit system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the Department of Transportation’s designated truck routes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Designating a larger percentage of NYPD traffic enforcement personnel to the enforcement of the DOT's designated truck routes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the public authorities law to provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated in passenger service on lines in the New York City transit system that travel through tunnels, under a body of water, or over a bridge; or during instances when trains in passenger service are composed of more than four cars, or are greater than three hundred sixty feet in length, or are able to carry a passenger load of more than 750 persons.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated on safety-sensitive lines in the NYC transit system.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Yassky and Fidler.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the public authorities law to provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated in passenger service on lines in the New York City transit system that travel through tunnels, under a body of water, or over a bridge; or during instances when trains in passenger service are composed of more than four cars, or are greater than three hundred sixty feet in length, or are able to carry a passenger load of more than 750 persons.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amended by Committee
Items.MatterName: Provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated on safety-sensitive lines in the NYC transit system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the public authorities law to provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated in passenger service on lines in the New York City transit system that travel through tunnels, under a body of water, or over a bridge; or during instances when trains in passenger service are composed of more than four cars, or are greater than three hundred sixty feet in length, or are able to carry a passenger load of more than 750 persons.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated on safety-sensitive lines in the NYC transit system.
